banner.text: Have you remembered to plug your Tilt sensor in?
Great! Now, bring your motion painting app to life with color.

Let's use a variable to store the color value.
Open the Variables tray.
Drag the block into your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Great! Change this from item to hue.

Let's set this to zero as a starting point.
Open the Variables tray.
Drag the block into your code space.
Connect it to this block.

Nice. Now, let's change the color of our brush.
Open the Color tray.
This block changes numbers into colors.
Now, connect it to this block.

We want to create a rainbow of color.
Change rgb to hsv to use the right palette.

Now, let's set our hue variable.
Open the Variables tray.
Drag the block into your code space...
...and connect it to this block.
Nice. Now change item to hue.

We only have one color right now, because our hue variable doesn't change.
Now open the Math tray.
This block adds a number to a variable.
Connect it to this block.

Change it to hue.
If you increase the hue variable every frame, the color will change too!
Now tilt your pixel kit and paint with motion! 🖌🌈
Awesome... you just made your very own Pixel app!
